title: Why Middle East Peace Requires Turning Off Iran’s Oil and Increasing Saudi’s
description: Shutting down Iran's oil exports and having Saudi Arabia replace production would be a key step to stabilizing the Middle East.

title: Biden Names Technology Hubs to Boost Industry and Create Jobs
description: The hubs, which touch 32 states and Puerto Rico, aim to spur innovation and create jobs in the industries that are concentrated in these areas.

title: Key Part of Antarctica Doomed to ‘Unavoidable’ Melting No Matter The Scale of Climate Action
description: No matter how much the world cuts back on carbon emissions, a sizable chunk of Antarctica will slowly collapse, warns a new study.

title: Artificially Cooling Rivers Could Protect Fish From Climate Change
description: Researchers in Canada are experimenting with ways of creating cold spots in warming rivers to help migrating salmon cool down.

title: Long COVID Research Is In Its ‘Most Hopeful’ Phase Yet
description: They're getting closer to finding tests and treatments.

title: What It’s Like to Be an Israeli Peace Activist During the Israel-Hamas War
description: There is little patience for the peace movement in Israel following Hamas' unprecedented attack on Oct. 7.

title: The History Behind the Right’s Effort to Take Over American Universities
description: The right has had qualms about universities since the 1930s.

title: How Giant Corporations Can Still Get Out of Paying Taxes
description: Two years after a global minimum tax was passed, a new report suggests that companies are finding new ways to avoid taxation.

title: Why Better Community Engagement is Key to The Future of Clean Tech
description: Engaging communities makes projects more likely to succeed in the short term and makes them more sustainable investments in the long run.

title: South China Sea Tensions Flare as Chinese and Philippine Vessels Collide in Disputed Waters
description: The “dangerous, illegal, and reckless maneuvers” by Chinese ships caused damage to Philippine vessels, said the office of President Ferdinand Marcos Jr.

title: The Long-Symbolic Price Cap on Russian Oil Is Now Being Put to the Test
description: With Russia's profits rising, the Israel-Hamas war pushing up global oil prices and evidence that some traders and shippers are evading the cap, the first signs of enforcement are appearing 10 months after the price limit was imposed in December.

title: Pakistan Court Indicts Ex-Leader Imran Khan for Leaking Secret Cable
description: Imran Khan remains the most popular politician in Pakistan despite his ouster in April 2022 and his jailing this year.

title: Indonesian Presidential Candidate Names Current President’s Son as Running Mate
description: The pairing could further solidify Jokowi’s political dynasty while shaking up alliances ahead of the Feb. 14 elections.

title: Showtime’s Excellent Fellow Travelers Traces a Forbidden Love of Historic Proportions
description: This wrenching eight-part adaptation of Thomas Mallon's novel casts Matt Bomer and Jonathan Bailey in a romance of historic proportions.

title: Argentina Economy Minister Massa and Right-Wing Populist Milei Head to Presidential Runoff
description: The polarized election will determine whether Argentina will continue with a center-left administration or elect an anti-establishment leader who promised profound changes to a country plagued by triple-digit inflation and rising poverty.
